name: The 2old2play 2012 Chicago Lan Halo 4 Release Party
blurb: After two years, the 2old2play.com LAN -- the premier gaming event for older gamers -- returns with Halo 4 to Chicago, Nov. 9 - 11.

rewards.reward: I Believe in 2o2p: Five bucks lets you just kick in for the LAN because you are awesomesauce (And don\u2019t ask us what we put in our awesomesauce. Trade secret.).
Absentee 2o2per Sponsorship: $20 gets you no advertisements for 3months and a site profile icon that screams, \u201cI SPONSORED THE 2O2P LAN! LOOK AT MY SWAG!\u201d
I Didn\u2019t Go, But The Shirt is Cool: As you might guess from the title, this one is an official LAN t-shirt, as well as no advertisements on the site for four months for the low, low cost of $35.

Clan this LAN: You get the same 2o2p lan shirt, but you represent your own clan with their logo on the back!  Even if you\u2019re not in attendance, you can know your clan will be by chipping in and representing at the Chicago LAN. (Includes a 3 months of no ads)
FIRST!  Be the first person to buy a LAN ticket, we\u2019ll throw in a free LAN t-shirt. And a blue ribbon for you to wear at the LAN. (Where does one get a blue ribbon anyway?)
Early Bird LAN Ticket: Get a LAN ticket for $90, which is $10 cheaper than everyone else is going to be paying for it. So you\u2019ll have that to hold over their heads. Nyah.

The Golden Ticket: A C-note gets you a golden ticket to the LAN itself, which is sort of like visiting Willy Wonka\u2019s chocolate factory, except without all the chocolate, or oompa loompas, or everlastinggobstoppers, or Mr. Wonka. Okay, it\u2019s nothing like that. The ticket isn\u2019t even actually gold. In fact, there are no actual tickets. They\u2019re \u201cvirtual.\u201d But \u2026 without the virtual ticket, you\u2019re not getting in. Without one, you\u2019ll be forced to listen to your friends who attend re-live what an awesome time they had without you.\r\n\r\n(Remember, you MUST be a member of 2old2play.com and be 25 years of age or older to come to the LAN. Please show up with ID or you will not be admitted into the LAN!!!)
LAN Ticket Plus T-shirt: Self explanatory. $125.00 gets you lan t-shirt and no advertisements on the site for four months (for you; not for everyone else; they still get to see the ads).

This Doodi is Smooth: (Includes LAN ticket)\r\nFor one hour during the LAN, Dsmooth and/or Doodi will personally fetch you beverages and snacks (though you still have to pay for said beverages and snacks), and generally be at your beck and call.

Clansorship: (Includes LAN ticket) A custom-made banner for your gaming Clan so as to properly represent at the 2o2p LAN. You have to provide the art, however. Unless you want your clan logo scanned in from LBsutke\u2019s crayon sketch of what he thinks your clan logo should look like ... As an added bonus, your clan leaders will get to fight at the end of the lan for the right to take the banner home.

Making the Rounds: (Includes LAN ticket) For just $225, you can buy yourself the path to internet celebritydom. You get to co-host the combined 2o2type and the Thick N Thin vidcast. As co-host, you can throw around your newfound fame by dictating the topics of conversation and generally standing on whatever your particular soapbox is (as long as it\u2019s gaming related).

LANanthropist: (Includes LAN ticket) This donation says you love LANs with all your heart, and want to share that joy with as many of your fellow gamers as possible. Your donation gets you designated as a LANanthropist (complete with a spiffy sash like the Ms. Universe girls wear), your company logo (or your name, if it\u2019s just you and no company) on the LAN Banner and your company logo (same as above) on the LAN web page as a sponsor. If you should also show up to the LAN, we can maybe find you a fancy hat and a monocle to help you look more distinguished.

Patron Saint of the 2o2p LAN: (Includes LAN ticket) This generous donation gets your company (or yourself) named above the title of (the 2012 202p LAN is brought to you by...), and the eternal thanks of more than 60 middle aged gamers who\u2019ll be celebrating in your name. Your company logo will appear on all LAN T-shirts, banners, and be put on the website (tbd!). Your sainthood is highlighted on both the 2old2type podcast and the T-N-T videocast running up to the LAN and for a month after. You are, of course, also welcome to attend the LAN itself, where the attendees will hoist a pint in unison and chant your name. Songs will be written about you and told to our children.
